กราฟ: Bitcoin สูญเสียกำไรทั้งหมดที่ได้รับมาตั้งแต่การเลือกตั้งของทรัมป์

CHART: Bitcoin has lost all of its gains since Trump’s election

1d ago//Bennett Tomlin
bitcoin
AI

Summary

TH

แม้ว่าดอนัลด์ ทรัมป์จะเข้าหา Bitcoin (BTC) และอุตสาหกรรมคริปโตอย่างเปิดเผย พร้อมกับแผนสร้างสำรับงานหมุนเวียนและการยกเลิกกฎระเบียบเก่า แต่ราคาสินทรัพย์ดิจิทัลกลับไม่ได้รับประโยชน์จากการบริหารงานของเขา แม้ผู้นำในวงการคริปโตจะหนุนหลังทรัมป์เพื่อหลบหลีกกฎระเบียบที่เข้มงวด แต่ความสัมพันธ์ทางการเมืองนี้ยังไม่ส่งผลให้ราคาโดดเด่นขึ้น ราคาของ Bitcoin (BTC) ได้ร่วงลงประมาณ 33% นับตั้งแต่ทรัมป์เข้ารับตำแหน่งประธานาธิบดี โดยตกจากประมาณ $101,000 เหลือเพียง $67,000 อนึ่ง คริปโตเหรียญนี้ยังสูญเสียมูลค่าที่เพิ่มขึ้นทั้งหมดนับตั้งแต่วันเลือกตั้งเมื่อวันที่ 5 พฤศจิกายน 2024 และปัจจุบันซื้อขายในระดับต่ำกว่าราคาในวันนั้น

EN

Despite Donald Trump's enthusiastic embrace of the cryptocurrency sector, including proposals for a strategic Bitcoin (BTC) reserve and deregulation, the asset has failed to maintain its value under his administration. While crypto industry leaders and enthusiasts heavily supported Trump in hopes of escaping strict regulations, this political alignment has not translated into financial success for investors. The price of BTC has plummeted approximately 33% since Trump's inauguration, falling from roughly $101,000 to around $67,000. Furthermore, the cryptocurrency has lost all gains accumulated since the November 2024 election, currently trading below the $67,800 level recorded on that day. Consequently, despite initial optimism, the market has not yet rewarded holders for the administration's pro-crypto rhetoric.

Key Points

  • Bitcoin (BTC) has dropped roughly 33% since Trump's inauguration, falling from $101,000 to $67,000.
  • Despite Trump's pro-crypto promises and support from industry leaders, prices have declined significantly.
  • BTC is currently trading lower than its price on the November 5, 2024 election date ($67,800), erasing all post-election gains.

Article

Donald Trump has embraced bitcoin (BTC) as a core part of his second administration, creating a strategic BTC reserve, insisting all BTC should be made in the United States, and destroying or disabling huge portions of the regulatory apparatus that had previously pursued cryptocurrency firms. Additionally, both he and his sons have vigorously embraced the industry in ways that continue to generate massive profits for this family. Many Bitcoiners and crypto enthusiasts were similarly ecstatic for the opportunity to support Trump and free themselves from the perceived tyranny of the Joseph Biden administration and the enforcement work of then-SEC head Gary Gensler. Jesse Powell, Tyler Winklevoss, and Cameron Winklevoss all ended up making donations to Trump that would have been illegal had they not been refunded . Read more: Who is behind World Liberty Financial, Trump’s new crypto? Despite this mutual embrace, the price of BTC hasn’t benefitted from the Trump administration. When Trump was inaugurated as president, BTC was trading for approximately $101,000. Today, it trades for approximately $67,000, a fall of approximately 33%. Even if we imagine that the value of BTC began increasing as soon as Trump was elected, before he had any real power, in anticipation of what he might do, BTC is still down since then. On November 5, 2024, the date of the presidential election, BTC was trading for approximately $67,800. Today, as mentioned before, it’s several hundred dollars less than that . Despite all the hopes Bitcoiners may have pinned on Trump, he’s done little to benefit their portfolios. Got a tip? Send us an email securely via Protos Leaks .
